cards.heading: Know the plate
cards.body: Capacity changes with attachments and lift height. Always check the data plate before lifting.

cards.heading: Low & tilted back
cards.body: Travel with forks low; slight back tilt for stability. Never travel with elevated loads.

cards.heading: Keep center inside
cards.body: Combined center of gravity must stay in the triangle. Forward loads reduce stability.

cards.heading: Height reduces capacity
cards.body: The higher you lift, the less weight you can safely carry. Check capacity charts.

cards.heading: Load center matters
cards.body: Distance from fork face to load center affects capacity. Closer is safer.

cards.heading: Wide turns only
cards.body: Make wide, slow turns to prevent load shift. Never take sharp corners with a load.
